programme.title: WNBA Basketball
programme.desc: New York claimed a 99-74 victory against Chicago in their first meeting of the season on May 22, led by 18 points and 8 assists from Natasha Cloud in 26 minutes; Rachel Banham posted 15 points and an assist for the Sky in 15 minutes played.

programme.title: 2025 NBA Finals
programme.desc: Oklahoma City evened the series at one game apiece with a 123-107 win over Indiana in Game 2 behind 34 points from Shai Gilgeous-Alexander and 20 points from Alex Caruso; Tyrese Haliburton led the Pacers with 17 points in the loss.

programme.title: Professional Fighters League
programme.desc: Top fighters from around the world engage in a full-contact combat sport that allows a wide variety of fighting methods and skills from Mixed Martial Arts traditions as the fighters look to move up the rankings and stake claim to championship gold.

programme.title: Numbers on the Board
programme.desc: Four friends talk all things NBA basketball and provide their unique perspectives, breaking down results from the recent games, the latest news making headlines across the league and rumors making the rounds that could create waves.

programme.title: UFC The Walk
programme.desc: Memorable bouts throughout UFC history are relived, showcasing the two fighters' paths to the bout, the training they went through to get ready for the contest and highlights from the bout to show who came out of the Octagon the winner.

programme.title: ESPN BET Live
programme.desc: Host and sports oddsmakers break down the latest betting action around sports, discussing some of the most recent lines on the marquee matchups and the upsets that bettors should be aware of before putting their money down on the game.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: With the help of Shaquille O'Neal and Penny Hardaway, the Orlando Magic franchise vaulted to the top of the NBA in the 90s and became a pop culture phenomenon, but as with all stories, the fairy tale came to an end when Shaq departed for the Lakers.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Isiah Thomas, Joe Dumars, Rick Mahorn, Dennis Rodman and Bill Laimbeer led the Detroit Pistons to back-to-back NBA championships in 1989 and 1990, but the team's tactics earned them a tough reputation and a memorable nickname that has endured.

programme.title: NBA Countdown
programme.desc: Expert analysts preview the upcoming action in the NBA, evaluating the strengths and weaknesses of each team while breaking down the pivotal matchups; coverage includes exclusive interviews, insightful commentary and special features.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The Lakers beat Philadelphia in the NBA Finals in 1980, 1982 and 1983, while Boston won the crown by beating Houston in 1981; Los Angeles and Boston staged the first of three epic battles in 1984, and the rivalry transformed fans' view of the game.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The Lakers and Celtics met in the NBA Finals for the first time in 1959, and in the 1960s the two franchises battled for the title six times; Bill Russell was a dominant figure for the Celtics, and Los Angeles featured Jerry West and Elgin Baylor.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: In 1978, the Celtics drafted Larry Bird, but he played his final year at Indiana State before signing; Los Angeles selected Magic Johnson No. 1 in 1979 after he led Michigan State to a victory over Bird and the Sycamores in the NCAA title game.

programme.title: Greenland
programme.desc: The docuseries showcases some of the most exotic and hidden soccer fields from around the world, showcasing how the field provides the locals an opportunity to grow the sport and the unique sights and surroundings that make the field stand out.

programme.title: Greenland
programme.desc: The docuseries showcases some of the most exotic and hidden soccer fields from around the world, showcasing how the field provides the locals an opportunity to grow the sport and the unique sights and surroundings that make the field stand out.

programme.title: The Ultimate Fighter
programme.desc: UFC Hall of Famers Daniel Cormier and Chael Sonnen select their eight-fighter teams of welterweights and flyweights from 10 different countries, as the action gets underway in the octagon between two of the recently-selected flyweights.

programme.title: USL Soccer
programme.desc: Rhode Island claimed a 3-0 victory against Louisville City in 2024's playoffs on Nov. 9, led by a brace from Jerome Williams after 79 minutes; Albert Dikwa found the net for Rhode Island's third goal of the win away from home in stoppage time.

programme.title: The Point
programme.desc: Analysts cover the latest around the world of the NHL, featuring highlights from recent games, previews of upcoming marquee matchups, the newest stories making headlines and all-access footage to give viewers a unique look at their favorite players.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Miami won three of four games against the Pirates in a season-opening series at LoanDepot Park; Pittsburgh swept the season series with the Marlins last year, outscoring the Marlins in the seven games, 43-24.

programme.title: Speak
programme.desc: The daily sports talk show delivers a compelling, incisive and passionate filter to the top sports stories of the day as the host engages in lively discussions, debates and disagreements over the day's news, and no topic is off limits.

programme.title: Breakfast Ball
programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: The Herd with Colin Cowherd
programme.desc: Breaking down the biggest sports news of the day along with various unique segments that help the host present his opinions on sports; players, coaches and celebrities are interviewed and discuss trending topics happening around the world.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Seattle won two of its three games against the Diamondbacks in their interleague series at T-Mobile Park last season; Arizona avoided a sweep last season with a 3-2 victory in the series finale.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Seattle won two of its three games against the Diamondbacks in their interleague series at T-Mobile Park last season; Arizona avoided a sweep last season with a 3-2 victory in the series finale.

programme.title: First Things First
programme.desc: Media personalities offer their views and opinions on the day's most intriguing storylines across the world of sports, including debates on the latest issues, analysis of player performances, and discussions on game results and other news.

programme.desc: Former football players break down the latest sports news making headlines across the country, giving a unique perspective from the athletes point of view on results of some of the recent marquee matchups and the stories impacting their league.

programme.title: TMZ Sports

programme.title: MotoGP
programme.desc: Marco Bezzecchi secured his first win since 2023 with a victory at Silverstone, while six-time champion Marc Marquez increased his lead over his brother, Alex, to 24 points; Marc Marquez won the main race at Aragon last year over Jorge Martin.

programme.desc: Media personalities offer their views and opinions on the day's most intriguing storylines across the world of sports, including debates on the latest issues, analysis of player performances, and discussions on game results and other news.

programme.title: Speak
programme.desc: The daily sports talk show delivers a compelling, incisive and passionate filter to the top sports stories of the day as the host engages in lively discussions, debates and disagreements over the day's news, and no topic is off limits.

programme.title: Breakfast Ball
programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: First Things First
programme.desc: Media personalities offer their views and opinions on the day's most intriguing storylines across the world of sports, including debates on the latest issues, analysis of player performances, and discussions on game results and other news.

programme.title: The Herd with Colin Cowherd
programme.desc: Breaking down the biggest sports news of the day along with various unique segments that help the host present his opinions on sports; players, coaches and celebrities are interviewed and discuss trending topics happening around the world.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: DC (6-4) split two meetings with the Battlehawks this season after earning a 27-15 triumph on the road in Week 3; St. Louis (8-2), the defending champion and winner of its last six contests, led the UFL with just 16.3 points allowed per game in 2025.

programme.title: Kevin Harvick's Happy Hour
programme.desc: Former NASCAR driver and 2014 Cup Series champion Kevin Harvick and his friends break down the latest news making headlines across NASCAR, going over the latest results and interview guests to gather their unique perspective on the sport.

programme.title: STIHL Timbersports Series
programme.desc: Competitive lumberjacks oppose each other in various disciplines based on traditional logging skills in an effort to determine the best all-around lumberjack; Hot Saw, Single Buck, Springboard Chop, Standing Block Chop, Stock Saw and Underhand Chop.

programme.title: UEFA World Cup Qualifying Matchweek Highlights
UEFA Nations League Soccer
programme.desc: Portugal claimed a 2-1 comeback victory against Germany in the semi-finals round on June 4 with goals from Francisco Conceição and Cristiano Ronaldo; Spain beat France, 5-4, on June 5, led by a pair of goals scored by Lamine Yamal.

programme.title: 2026 UEFA World Cup Qualifiers
programme.desc: Malta (0-1-2) earned its first point with its scoreless draw with Lithuania on June 7; Netherlands (1-0-0) opened Group G play with a 2-0 triumph over Finland in Week 3, as Memphis Depay and Denzel Dumfries each scored in the first half.

programme.title: 2026 UEFA World Cup Qualifiers
programme.desc: Moldova (0-0-2) plays its first match on the road after falling to Norway (March 22) and Estonia (March 25); Italy (0-0-1), which allowed three first-half goals to suffer a 3-0 setback to Norway in Week 3, is 3-0-0 all-time against Selectionata.

programme.desc: Unprecedented drivers' seat access to the top NTT IndyCar Series as they compete in the greatest racing event on the planet - the Indianapolis 500.

programme.title: NHRA Pro Mod Series
programme.desc: The top pro modified drivers compete against each other with three different engine setups in nitrous, blower and turbo, featuring detailed coverage of all the racing action, updates on track conditions, and highlights of memorable moments.

programme.title: 2025 CONCACAF Women's U-20 Championship
programme.desc: Mexico defeated Costa Rica, 4-0, to advance, and beat Canada in the group stage, 4-2, behind two goals from Montserrat Saldivar and one from Maria Gonzalez; Canada shut out United States, 1-0, behind the lone goal from Lea Larouche.

programme.title: ARCA Racing
programme.desc: Austin Green secured his first Menards Series win of his career with his victory at Charlotte over Grant Enfinger; Connor Zilisch averaged 149.44 en route to his win at Michigan last year, beating eventual 2024 champion Andres Perez by 0.701 seconds.

programme.title: NHRA Pro Mod Series
programme.desc: The top pro modified drivers compete against each other with three different engine setups in nitrous, blower and turbo, featuring detailed coverage of all the racing action, updates on track conditions, and highlights of memorable moments.

NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series
programme.desc: Rajah Caruth secured his first win of the season with his victory at Nashville over points leader Corey Heim, his eighth podium finish of 2025; Truck Series races at Michigan for the first time since Zane Smith won in 2020 over Christian Eckes.

programme.title: NHRA Drag Racing
programme.desc: Tony Stewart leads Shawn Langdon in Top Fuel by 71 points, Austin Prock leads Jack Beckman in Funny Car by 38 points and Greg Anderson leads Dallas Glenn in Pro Stock by 50 points following Epping, the seventh event of the 2025 season.

programme.title: Canadian Shield Soccer
programme.desc: Invitational tournament contested by hosts Canada plus Ukraine, Ivory Coast and New Zealand; draws will go to penalties to award two points with winners and losers earning standard points as teams strive to top the standings after two matches each.

programme.title: International Friendly
programme.desc: Hungary claimed a 1-0 victory against Azerbaijan in their most recent meeting in a EURO tournament qualifier from Oct. 2019, through a winner scored by Mihály Korhut; Korhut found the net with the lone goal of the match in the 11th minute of play.

programme.title: Best Lessons Ever
programme.desc: Top players throughout PGA history share their tips and instruction to help viewers improve their own golf game, showing their techniques and thought processes with a variety of shots that they have implemented in their career to find success.

programme.title: Golf Channel Academy
programme.desc: Jim Furyk, the 2003 U.S. Open Champion, shares the techniques behind his full swing, featuring an insightful breakdown that can help players across the spectrum improve their game, useful tips and advice, and details for lowering scores.

programme.desc: Jim Furyk, the 2003 U.S. Open Champion, shares the techniques behind his full swing, featuring an insightful breakdown that can help players across the spectrum improve their game, useful tips and advice, and details for lowering scores.

programme.title: Golf Channel Academy
programme.desc: Gary Williams joins two-time U.S. Open Champion Lee Janzen for a breakdown of what it takes for a player to develop elite skills in the short game arena, including useful drills for improvement and an explanation as to why variety is good.

programme.title: Golf Channel Academy
programme.desc: In Ponte Vedra Beach, sixteen-time PGA Tour champion Jim Furyk teams up with host Michael Breed for insightful talks about all things putting, including his most useful drills, two key fundamentals, and the importance of practice a certain way.

programme.title: Golf Channel Academy
programme.desc: From Windermere, Fla., at the Golden Bear Club at Keen's Pointe, Retief Goosen, the two-time U.S. Open Champion, talks with Martin Hall about aspects of his putting game, including useful techniques and the secrets behind his skill.

programme.title: Golf Channel Academy
programme.desc: Michael Breed meets Jim Furyk at Ponte Vedra Beach for a detailed look at insights and techniques for chipping and pitching like the best professionals, including being the best with a wedge and the importance of focusing on the fundamentals.

programme.title: Golf Channel Academy
programme.desc: In Windermere, Fla., two-time U.S. Open winner Retief Goosen teams up with host Martin Hall for insightful discussions on everything pertaining to full swing, including his smooth tempo, the secrets to consistent iron play, and the keys to success.
